Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents a Sudoku Board.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Joel Uong

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Default Constructor - standard 9 x 9 Sudoku board
      pre: None
      post: Instantiation of puzzle as a 9 x 9 board
      Board(int[][] n)
      Constructor takes in 2D array and creates a deep copy of n to puzzle
      pre: dimension = n.length = n[0].length.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getDimension()
      Get method for dimension pre: none
      int getVal(int row, int col)
      Get Method for puzzle - gets a value given position
      pre: 0 <= row < 9, 0 <= col < 9
      boolean isValidSetup()
      Checks and see if the current Sudoku puzzle is a valid set up (excluding 0's)
      pre: none
      void setVal(int row, int col, int val)
      Set Method for puzzle - sets a specified position to a value
      pre: 0 <= row < dimension, 0 <= col < dimension, 0 <= val <= dimension
      post: puzzle[row][col] = val
      java.lang.String toString()
      Method prints out the Sudoku board in a string representation
      pre: none

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board()
        Default Constructor - standard 9 x 9 Sudoku board
        pre: None
        post: Instantiation of puzzle as a 9 x 9 board

      • Board

        public Board(int[][] n)
        Constructor takes in 2D array and creates a deep copy of n to puzzle
        pre: dimension = n.length = n[0].length. Dimension must be a perfect square
        All values in n must be between 0 - dimension inclusive, where 0 is an empty spot
        post: puzzle[row][col] == n[row][col] for all values of row and col
        Parameters:
        n - - 2D array of ints

    • Method Detail

      • setVal

        public void setVal(int row,
                   int col,
                   int val)
        Set Method for puzzle - sets a specified position to a value
        pre: 0 <= row < dimension, 0 <= col < dimension, 0 <= val <= dimension
        post: puzzle[row][col] = val
        Parameters:
        row - - row based on 0 base indexing
        col - - column based on 0 base indexing
        val - - value that should be inserted at position(row, col)

      • getVal

        public int getVal(int row,
                  int col)
        Get Method for puzzle - gets a value given position
        pre: 0 <= row < 9, 0 <= col < 9
        Parameters:
        row - - row based on 0 base indexing
        col - - column based on 0 base indexing
        Returns:
        Value specified at position(row, col)

      • getDimension

        public int getDimension()
        Get method for dimension pre: none
        Returns:
        Returns dimension of puzzle

      • isValidSetup

        public boolean isValidSetup()
        Checks and see if the current Sudoku puzzle is a valid set up (excluding 0's)
        pre: none
        Returns:
        Returns true if the current Sudoku puzzle is a valid set up, false otherwise

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method prints out the Sudoku board in a string representation
        pre: none
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Returns Sudoku board in string format
